limebrokerage.trading.api

Class AlgoOrderOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • limebrokerage.trading.api.AlgoOrderOptions

  • public final class AlgoOrderOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Order options for Algo orders for US-Equities securities. All setters return the object, so that multiple sets can be easily chained together.

    Not all order options are applicable for all venues or account types. Setting an option where not allowed or not applicable will result in an order reject.

    See Also:
    Client.placeAlgo(long, int, long, limebrokerage.trading.api.Side, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

    • Method Detail

      • setTimeInForce

        public AlgoOrderOptions setTimeInForce(TimeInForce tif)
        Enables the time-in-force option. This option determines how long the order will remain live. The default is to stay live for the rest of the day. Certain TIF values may require additional options set.
        Parameters:
        tif - Time-in-force setting
        Returns:
        itself
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - setting a TIF value not appropriate for an Algo order

      • setExpireTime

        public AlgoOrderOptions setExpireTime(java.util.Date expire)
        Enables the expire-time option. This option must only be set in conjunction with the TimeInForce.GOOD_TILL_DATE TIF option and is required for it. It determines the time when the order should expire.
        Parameters:
        expire - expiration time
        Returns:
        itself
        See Also:
        TimeInForce.GOOD_TILL_DATE

      • setShortSaleAffirmLongQuantity

        public AlgoOrderOptions setShortSaleAffirmLongQuantity(int quantity)
        Enables the short-sale affirm long-quantity option. This option is required for certain accounts and affirms that the client has the given long position in the security being traded. This option can only be set for orders which are short-sales. The value must be greater than zero.
        Parameters:
        quantity - long position being affirmed
        Returns:
        itself
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - setting a negative or zero value
        See Also:
        OrderOptions.setSaleAffirm()

        public AlgoOrderOptions setInvisible()

        Returns:
        itself

      • setQuickstart

        public AlgoOrderOptions setQuickstart(QuickstartSetting qs)
        Enables the quickstart option.
        Parameters:
        qs - quickstart; overrides the strategy quickstart settings -- if set to enable the order will not wait for market data before sending out child orders to the markets, if disable, it will wait to achieve a minimum quorum, none results in strategy's default behavior.
        Returns:
        itself

      • setSweepType

        public AlgoOrderOptions setSweepType(SweepType type)
        Enables the sweepType option.
        Parameters:
        qs - sweepType; overrides the strategy sweepType settings -- if set to standard, it will override the strategy configured option for a standard sweep. ISO setting will trigger ISO on parent order.
        Returns:
        itself

      • setMaxMarketOrderSlippageAmount

        public AlgoOrderOptions setMaxMarketOrderSlippageAmount(int diff)
        Enables the max market order slippage amount option.
        Parameters:
        diff - max slippage amount for market orders to diverge from NBBO when LSR receives the order as the market moves away (scaled by Client.PRICE_SCALE)
        Returns:
        itself

      • setExcludedVenues

        public AlgoOrderOptions setExcludedVenues(java.lang.String venues)
        Enables the excluded Venues option.
        Parameters:
        venues - comma separated list of exDestinations for the venues to be excluded for the strategy or sequence of strategies. Whitespace is not allowed.
        Returns:
        itself
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - setting an empty or too large string

      • setRegularSessionOnly

        public AlgoOrderOptions setRegularSessionOnly()
        Enables the regularSessionOnly option. Only in combination with tif = DAY. Means this order will participate in opening auction and regular session only.
        Returns:
        itself

Securities are offered by Lime Trading Corp., member FINRA & SIPC,NFA. All investing incurs risk, including but not limited to loss of principal. Further information may be found on our Disclosures Page.

Please read the following documents Characteristics and Risks of Standardized Options before trading options. Options involve risk and are not suitable for all investors as the special risks inherent to options trading may expose investors to potentially rapid and substantial losses. Options trading privileges are subject to Lime Trading Corp. review and approval. Hedging and protective strategies generally involve additional costs and do not assure a profit or guarantee against loss. With long options, investors may lose 100% of funds invested. Covered calls provide income, downside protection only to the extent of the premium received, and limit upside potential to the strike price plus premium received. Multi-leg option orders are not a standard option trade. There is no national best bid or offer for multi-leg orders. Multi-leg trades are executed on the exchanges at the discretion of specialists or market makers, who cannot be held to a net price on a multi-leg order. Therefore, you may not receive the national best bid or offer on each individual leg of an order. Multi-leg orders are executed as a single trade on the same exchange. Legs cannot be executed separately on different exchanges to get the national best bid or offer for each leg. Each individual leg of a multi-leg order can be subject to early exercise risk, possibly taking away the protection that the multi-leg position may provide. Partial or full assignment on a leg may originate a margin call or losses greater than you anticipated when you entered into the position. When a multi-leg order is canceled or filled, additional reporting may be required by the specialist or market maker. Reporting fills and cancels may cause delays and create risks, especially in fast moving markets. Other risks might be associated with multi-leg options trading.
